channel.title: Hosting Problem
channel.description:
Hi, I used to be able to run No-IP address for people to connect to my server but then, after a pc reboot, it stoppe working, I have redone everything I fif before the reboot and yet to no avail... D:
PLEASE DO NOT JUST POST A LINK GUIDE, I HAVE SHOWN WHAT I HAVE DONE AND I DIDN'T JUST MAGICALLY THINK THIS UP I HAVE USED COUNTLESS GUIDES!
These are my setting in a nutshell:
No-Ip Port Forwarding (made 3 using 3 dif ip addresses, 1st what is shown in no-ip, 2nd is defult, 3rd is my statis I THINK) [IMG]http://i381.photobucket.com/albums/oo256/jake_tyrrell/PortForwarding.jpg[/img] UTorrent [IMG]http://i381.photobucket.com/albums/oo256/jake_tyrrell/UTorrent.jpg[/img] Variables [IMG]http://i381.photobucket.com/albums/oo256/jake_tyrrell/Variables.jpg[/img] Firewall [IMG]http://i381.photobucket.com/albums/oo256/jake_tyrrell/Firewall.jpg[/img]
Someone Please help me, It will be much appreciated, just tell me where I went wrong && how to fix please
Thanks for your time.

item.title: Hosting Problem
item.dc:creator: @cloudscape cloudscape
item.description:
@cloudscape wrote:

ok, first option, i am using BT Broadband, and thats what make my router is, and firewall setting doesn’t appear on there, second option, i already have both that and i showed that in a pic in my original post

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting Problem
item.dc:creator: @Asante213 Asante213
item.description:
@Asante213 wrote:

Search Ipchicken in google, then it should tell you your ip copy and past it in your web browser, then go to firewall settings and see if your decimatation(Or W.e) is still on their, and if it is go to start, then control panel, then internet connections and networks, then windows firewall (Or Firewall), then click the exception bar and if No-Ip isnt on that list, Click add program add No-Ip, also make sure you have port 43594 added, but i think you should have that!

Read full topic

item.description:
@Asante213 wrote:

Put your Ip in your web browser and see if No-Ip is still set in your firewall, and in your control panel firewall!
